column4: can anyone help me?  having some trouble regarding ram in Ubuntu 10.04.  the problem is: i have 4GB of ram installed, but only 2.7GB is shown.  also, i am already using the PAE kernel
shared video ram?  corrupt memory?
not sure.  my bios clearly says 4096 MB memory is there, but when i free -m it only shows 2770 total
wanna pastebin your free -m
that can be arranged
very odd... try memtest on boot see what that shows and do a test.
http://pastebin.com/k9ABvy07
im at a loss.. what version of ubuntu is it..
does a livecd show any different?
i've been having a headache with this since last night, also.  doesn't make any sense
run the memtest at boot..if that shows only 2.7gb then something is badly wrong.
bbiab, then.  thank you for the assistance!
running memtest didn't show me anything different :(
and bios says 4gig?
try removing/reinserting the memory.
any setting in bios that might be using it somewhere else or whatnot
iGPU frame buffer is set on 512, but should that account for that much "missing" memory?
maybe its the kernel not supporting your chipset properly.
try a mainline kernel from ppa
Im at a loss really
as am i.  how do i mainline ther kernel from ppa?
http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/
